data.enText: a very strong feeling of dislike for sb/sth
He looked at me with intense hatred.

data.chText: 他的声音里透露着恐惧和仇恨。
data.enText: There was fear and hatred in his voice.

data.chText: 她对攻击她的人只有恨。
data.enText: She felt nothing but hatred for her attacker.
racial hatred (= between people from different races)

data.chText: 这一辩论只不过再次挑起了夙仇。
data.enText: The debate simply revived old hatreds.

data.chText: 这两个词意义相似。hatred较常用以指对人或事物的强烈仇恨、憎恨：
data.enText: These two words have a similar meaning. Hatred is more often used to describe a very strong feeling of dislike for a particular person or thing.

data.chText: 一眼便能看出她对姐姐恨之入骨。
data.enText: Her deep hatred of her sister was obvious.

data.chText: hate较常用以泛指仇恨、憎恨、厌恶：
data.enText: Hate is more often used when you are talking about this feeling in a general way.

tr: a feeling of dislike so strong that it demands action

value.def: Hatred is an extremely strong feeling of dislike for someone or something.

example.ex: Her hatred of them would never lead her to murder...
example.tran: 她虽说仇恨他们，但绝不至于去杀人。

example.ex: My hatred for her is so intense it seems to be destroying me...
example.tran: 我对她恨之入骨，都快要无法自拔了。

example.ex: He has been accused of inciting racial hatred.

gramarinfo.label: also N in pl, oft N <l>of/for</l> n
